attributes.comment:
USCIS should add a charge for immigrant visa processing, charging those
individuals directly by having the State Department collect the fee as part of the
fee for applying for an immigrant visa, insteads of transferring those costs to other
applicants for USCIS services.

A person who applies for asylum and has their application denied should be
required to pay the full cost of their asylum application before they can apply for
any other benefit or visa.

To encourage naturalization, yet not have it be a loss-leader, USCIS should not
apply the fee waiver surcharge to naturalization applications.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
